title: Battle-Hardened Kurds Face Military Imbalance in Turkey’s Syria Offensive
text:
BEIRUT—Kurdish forces, with U.S. backing, eliminated Islamic State’s caliphate in the battlefields of northeastern Syria and vowed to defend territory it won. Now pitted against Turkey without the support of the U.S., the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces are outgunned and vulnerable.

Kurdish fighters spent months digging trenches, constructing underground tunnels and stockpiling weapons ahead of the Turkish cross-border offensive that began Wednesday. In two days of fighting against the North Atlantic Treaty Organization’s...
description: Pitted against Turkey without the support of the U.S., the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces are outgunned and vulnerable.
